member.name: M:Mono.TextEditor.TextEditorKeyPressTimings.EndTimer(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Overhead to a key press of using StartTimer and EndTimer is normally about 0.0017ms
Note that the first ever key press in the text editor this can add up to ~0.1ms but this is small compared with the text editor key press itself which can take ~800ms for the first ever key press in the text editor for the current IDE session.

member.name: M:Mono.TextEditor.Utils.Diff.SMS``1(Mono.TextEditor.Utils.DiffData{``0},System.Int32,System.Int32,Mono.TextEditor.Utils.DiffData{``0},System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32[],System.Int32[])
member.summary: This is the algorithm to find the Shortest Middle Snake (SMS).
member.param: lower bound of the actual range in DataA
upper bound of the actual range in DataA (exclusive)
lower bound of the actual range in DataB
upper bound of the actual range in DataB (exclusive)
a vector for the (0,0) to (x,y) search. Passed as a parameter for speed reasons.
a vector for the (u,v) to (N,M) search. Passed as a parameter for speed reasons.
member.returns: a MiddleSnakeData record containing x,y and u,v

member.name: M:Mono.TextEditor.Utils.Diff.LCS``1(Mono.TextEditor.Utils.DiffData{``0},System.Int32,System.Int32,Mono.TextEditor.Utils.DiffData{``0},System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32[],System.Int32[])
member.summary: This is the divide-and-conquer implementation of the longest common-subsequence (LCS) algorithm. The published algorithm passes recursively parts of the A and B sequences. To avoid copying these arrays the lower and upper bounds are passed while the sequences stay constant.
member.param: lower bound of the actual range in DataA
upper bound of the actual range in DataA (exclusive)
lower bound of the actual range in DataB
upper bound of the actual range in DataB (exclusive)
a vector for the (0,0) to (x,y) search. Passed as a parameter for speed reasons.
a vector for the (u,v) to (N,M) search. Passed as a parameter for speed reasons.

member.name: T:Mono.TextEditor.Utils.HtmlWriter
member.summary: This class is used for converting a highlighted document to html.

member.name: M:Mono.TextEditor.Utils.HtmlWriter.GenerateCFHtmlHeader(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Generates a CF_HTML clipboard format header.

summary.p: This class represents an immutable character sequence with fast {@link #concat concatenation}, {@link #insert insertion} and {@link #delete deletion} capabilities (O[Log(n)]) instead of O[n] for StringBuffer/StringBuilder).

p.i: Implementation Note: To avoid expensive copy operations , {@link ImmutableText} instances are broken down into smaller immutable sequences, they form a minimal-depth binary tree. The tree is maintained balanced automatically through tree rotations. Insertion/deletions are performed in O[Log(n)] instead of O[n] for StringBuffer/StringBuilder.

member.name: F:Mono.TextEditor.Utils.ImmutableText.BLOCK_SIZE
member.summary: Holds the default size for primitive blocks of characters.

member.name: F:Mono.TextEditor.Utils.ImmutableText.BLOCK_MASK
member.summary: Holds the mask used to ensure a block boundary cesures.

member.name: P:Mono.TextEditor.Utils.ImmutableText.Length
member.summary: Returns the length of this text.
member.value: the number of characters (16-bits Unicode) composing this text.

member.name: P:Mono.TextEditor.Utils.ImmutableText.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets/Sets a single character. Runs in O(lg N) for random access. Sequential read-only access benefits from a special optimization and runs in amortized O(1).

member.name: M:Mono.TextEditor.Utils.ImmutableText.Concat(Mono.TextEditor.Utils.ImmutableText)
member.summary: Concatenates the specified text to the end of this text. This method is very fast (faster even than StringBuffer.append(String)) and still returns a text instance with an internal binary tree of minimal depth!
member.param: that the text that is concatenated.

member.name: M:Mono.TextEditor.Utils.ImmutableText.InsertText(System.Int32,Mono.TextEditor.Utils.ImmutableText)
member.summary: Returns the text having the specified text inserted at the specified location.
member.returns: subtext(0, index).concat(txt).concat(subtext(index))

member.name: M:Mono.TextEditor.Utils.ImmutableText.RemoveText(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the text without the characters between the specified indexes.

member.name: M:Mono.TextEditor.Utils.ImmutableText.GetText(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a portion of this text.
member.returns: the sub-text starting at the specified start position and ending just before the specified end position.

member.name: M:Mono.TextEditor.Utils.ImmutableText.CopyTo(System.Char[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies the whole content of the immutable text into the specified array. Runs in O(N).
member.remarks: This method counts as a read access and may be called concurrently to other read accesses.

member.name: M:Mono.TextEditor.Utils.ImmutableText.CopyTo(System.Int32,System.Char[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies the a part of the immutable text into the specified array. Runs in O(lg N + M).
member.remarks: This method counts as a read access and may be called concurrently to other read accesses.

member.name: M:Mono.TextEditor.Utils.ImmutableText.ToArray
member.summary: Creates an array and copies the contents of the rope into it. Runs in O(N).
member.remarks: This method counts as a read access and may be called concurrently to other read accesses.

member.name: M:Mono.TextEditor.Utils.ImmutableText.ToArray(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates an array and copies the contents of the rope into it. Runs in O(N).
member.remarks: This method counts as a read access and may be called concurrently to other read accesses.

member.name: M:Mono.TextEditor.Utils.ImmutableText.EnsureChunked
member.summary: When first loaded, ImmutableText contents are stored as a single large array. This saves memory but isn't modification-friendly as it disallows slightly changed texts to retain most of the internal structure of the original document. Whoever retains old non-chunked version will use more memory than really needed.
member.returns: A copy of this text better prepared for small modifications to fully enable structure-sharing capabilities

member.name: T:Mono.TextEditor.Utils.TextBreaker
member.summary: A utility class for breaking up the text in TextEditors

member.name: M:Mono.TextEditor.Utils.TextBreaker.BreakLinesIntoWords(Mono.TextEditor.MonoTextEditor,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Breaks the lines into words in the form of a list of TextSegments. A 'word' is defined as an identifier (a series of letters, digits or underscores) or a single non-identifier character (including white space characters)
member.returns: The list of segments representing the 'words' in the lines
member.param: The text editor to get the words from
The first line in the editor's documents to get the words from
The number of lines to get words from

member.returns: The list of segments representing the 'words' in the lines
member.param: The document to get the words from
The first line in the documents to get the words from
The number of lines to get words from

member.name: M:Mono.TextEditor.TextEditorData.CreateImmutable(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates the a text editor data object which document can't be changed. This is useful for 'view' only documents.
member.remarks: The Document itself is very fast because it uses a special case buffer and line splitter implementation. Additionally highlighting is turned off as default.

members.member: TODO: CairoExtensions.CachedDraw seems not to work correctly for me.

member.name: T:MonoDevelop.SourceEditor.FileRegistry
member.summary: The File registry handles events that are affecting all open source views to allow the operations to 'do action on all'/'ignore action on all'. (think of 50 files that needs to be reloaded)

member.name: T:MonoDevelop.SourceEditor.Braces.BraceCompletionAdornmentService
member.summary: A service for displaying an adornment under the inner most closing brace.

member.name: T:MonoDevelop.SourceEditor.Braces.BraceCompletionAggregator
member.summary:
This class combines IBraceCompletionSessionProvider, IBraceCompletionContextProvider, and IBraceCompletionDefaultProvider session providers. The aggregator will create a session using the best match with the following priorities.
1. OpeningBrace 2. ContentType 3. Provider type: SessionProviders > ContextProviders > DefaultProviders

member.name: M:MonoDevelop.SourceEditor.Braces.BraceCompletionAggregator.TryCreateSession(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Editor.ITextView,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.SnapshotPoint,System.Char,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.BraceCompletion.IBraceCompletionSession@)
member.summary: Attempt to create a session using the provider that best matches the buffer content type for the given opening brace. This is called only for appropriate buffers in the view's buffer graph.

member.name: M:MonoDevelop.SourceEditor.Braces.BraceCompletionAggregator.IsSupportedContentType(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.IContentType,System.Char)
member.summary: Checks the content type against the providers.
member.returns: True if providers exist for the given content type.

member.name: P:MonoDevelop.SourceEditor.Braces.BraceCompletionAggregator.OpeningBraces
member.summary: Gives a string containing all opening brace chars that have providers

member.name: P:MonoDevelop.SourceEditor.Braces.BraceCompletionAggregator.ClosingBraces
member.summary: Gives a string containing all closing brace chars that have providers

member.name: M:MonoDevelop.SourceEditor.Braces.BraceCompletionAggregator.Init
member.summary: Build the _providerCache Each opening brace is a key with a value of the providers and metadata in a sorted list. The list is order from most specific to least specific content types with the provider type sorted secondary.

member.name: M:MonoDevelop.SourceEditor.Braces.BraceCompletionAggregator.SortContentTypes(System.Collections.Generic.List{Microsoft.VisualStudio.Utilities.IContentType})
member.summary: Sorts content types by most specific to least specific. This checks the type against all others until it finds one that it is a type of. List.Sort() does not work here since most types are unrelated.

member.name: T:MonoDevelop.SourceEditor.Braces.BraceCompletionAggregator.ProviderHelper
member.summary: A private helper class to wrap lazy instances of Session, Context, and Default providers into one type.

member.name: T:MonoDevelop.SourceEditor.Braces.BraceCompletionDefaultSession
member.summary: BraceCompletionDefaultSession is a language neutral brace completion session capable of handling the default behaviors. Language specific behaviors and formatting are handled by the optional IBraceCompletionContext.
Default session with no context
Default session with a language specific context

member.name: T:MonoDevelop.SourceEditor.Braces.BraceCompletionManager
member.summary: A per view manager for brace completion. This is called by the command filter in the editor pkg.

member.name: T:MonoDevelop.SourceEditor.Braces.BraceCompletionStack
member.summary: Represents the stack of active brace completion sessions. The stack handles removing sessions no longer in focus as well as marking the inner most closing brace with the adornment.

member.name: P:MonoDevelop.SourceEditor.Braces.IBraceCompletionAdornmentService.Point
member.summary: Gets or sets the tracking point used by the brace completion adornment to indicate the closing brace. The adornment span is length one with the given point as the end.
member.remarks: Setting the tracking point to null clears the adornment.

member.summary: Creates an IBraceCompletionAdornmentService for the given text view.
member.remarks: Only one IBraceCompletionAdornmentService will exist per view.

member.summary: A unique list of all opening braces that have providers.

member.name: P:MonoDevelop.SourceEditor.Braces.IBraceCompletionAggregator.ClosingBraces
member.summary: A unique list of all closing braces that have providers

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Adornments.ToolTipPresenterStyle
member.summary: Defines a set of properties that will be used to style the default WPF ToolTip presenter.
member.remarks: This is a MEF component part, and should be exported with the following attributes: [Export(typeof(ToolTipPresenterStyle))] [Name] [Order] All exports of this component part should be ordered before the "default" ToolTip presenter style. At a minimum, this means adding [Order(Before="default")] to the export metadata.
